channel.title: Rules with ∃ :: CIS 301 Textbook
channel.description: In this section, we will see the two inference rules for the existential (∃) quantifier. Exists introduction We can use the exists introduction rule, ExistsI[T], when we have a proposition of the form P(a) for an arbitrary member a of a domain. Since we found one individual where a proposition held, then we can also say that there exists an individual for which the proposition is true. We can formalize the rule as follows:
